Is it "morally" correct? Questioning the use of an emulator's advantages
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Miscellaneous Q&A (Post New Questions Here): Is it "morally" correct? Questioning the use of an emulator's advantages
By Sivart on Wednesday, January 13, 2010 - 07:50 pm:

Playing Monster Rancher 2 through an emulator has tangible pros and cons, but to me, the biggest advantage (aside from save states, but that's not quite the same) is the removal of an FPS limit. It's kind of like a light gray area because I can see how some would argue that removing the limit and making the game run at hyper speed is unfair to those who cannot.

What are your thoughts?

By Raistlin_Majere on Thursday, January 14, 2010 - 06:39 pm:

imho, nope... as long as you don't cheat on the items, gold etc... it is okay....

By Swezlon Uno on Thursday, January 14, 2010 - 07:05 pm:

It speeds up the process, but technically the same rules and boundaries apply, that's my take on it anyway.
